description:
This course is about Boolean Algebra, which is essential to understand digital electronics.

In five lectures you are going to learn

- all theorems (Assicuativity, Commutativity, Distributibity, Identity, Annihilator, Idempotence, Absorption, Complementation and De MorganÂ´s Law (negation))

- logic gates (AND, OR, NOT, NOR, NAND, XOR, XNOR),

- truth tables (read and create them)

- Karnaugh-Maps (Minterm & Maxterm) to simplify functions

- draw and analyse circuits.

The topics are covered in a consise, but understandable way.

Each lecture provides some exercises to revise what you have learned.

After you have completed the lecture, you will find for practising some exercises. I will explain the solution.


This course is for beginners and highly recommended for those who are interested in advanced digital electronics or studying either Computer Science or Computer Hardware & Software Engineering.
title: Boolean Algebra
